text: Clarence Malcolm Lowry (; 28 July 1909 â€“ 26 June 1957) was a British writer from the Wirral. He is most famous for his 1947 novel Under the Volcano about an alcoholic Consul in Mexico. Lowry was himself an alcoholic and a lot of his writings were about the effect alcohol had on his life and on the lives of his characters. ==References== *Under the Volcano by Malcolm Lowry.
